intro: Landolphia dawei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, white flowers that open at night. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to humans and animals. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and vine-like. Landolphia dawei is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
